alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Nash (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 6:14PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Nash, northeastern Wake, north central Johnston and south central Franklin Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 614 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clayton, or 13 miles southeast of Raleigh, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Garner, Clayton, Zebulon, Bailey, Bunn, Knightdale, Wendell, Rolesville and Spring Hope. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding.
